snippet: An agreement signed by the government and rebels on Friday started to dissolve with gunfire as early as Monday — the second time this year that a pact was broken.
abstract: South Sudan's agreement for a cease-fire barely makes it into the new week before violence resumes in the seething conflict that has already left thousands dead and displaced more than 1.3 million people; government and the rebels accuse each other of violating the short-lived accord.
lead_paragraph: An agreement signed by the government and rebels on Friday started to dissolve with gunfire as early as Monday — the second time this year that a pact was broken.

headline.main: South Sudan Cease-Fire Proves to Be Short-Lived
headline.print_headline: South Sudan Cease-Fire Proves to Be Short-Lived
